column1: #Text=Polycrystalline  samples  of  Gd0.8Sr0.2Fe0.8M0.2O3  (M  =  Cr,  Ga)  are  prepared  by  combustion  route  and  pore  wetting  technique  in  order  to  compare  the  influence  of  the  morphology  in  the  performance  of  two  cathodes  for  Solid  Oxide  Fuel  Cells.
#Text=Powders  of  Gd0.8Sr0.2Fe0.8M0.2O3  (M  =  Cr,  Ga)  were  prepared  according  to  combustion  synthesis  route  using  glycine   as   fuel.

#Text=Appropriate   amounts   of   the   nitrate   salts   [Gd(NO3)3   6H2O;   Sr(NO3)2;   Fe(NO3)3   9H2O; Cr(NO3)2·6H2O;  Ga(NO3)3 H2O]  were  dissolved  in  distilled  water  and  glycine  was  later  added  to  the  solution.

#Text=A  concentrated  gel  was  formed  when  the  solution  was  dried  and  nitrate-glycine-mixture-gel  turns  to  a  vigorous  fire,  which lasted a few seconds until the combustion process was completed.
#Text=The resulting powders were calcined first at 800 ºC for 8 hours in air, then pressed into pellets and calcined again at 1300 ºC for 10h.
